[Module]: Middleware
[ITChecklistAddress]: NULL
[OpenSourceInfo]:
[DependsOn]:
[DetailInfo]: 1. root cause: info report module will start a timer
                when iphone/usb device plug in. to make sure
                /dev/hidraw* is made and get device info successfully.
                but it is frequently about 100ms once and hold about 5
                seconds. The timer is use select to implement. which
                might influence other IPC like dbus in my opinion.
              2. solution: stop timer if get iphone device info
              successfully.

              4. dependency: hmi

subject: hmi, info-report crash happen after carplay connect. usb will still in device mode, which cause usb can't be detected for ever.
commitMessage:
hmi, info-report crash happen after carplay connect.
usb will still in device mode, which cause usb can't
be detected for ever.

[IssueID]: TS-BUG-5362
[Component]: Carplay
[Module]: Middleware
[ITChecklistAddress]: NULL
[OpenSourceInfo]:
[DependsOn]:
[DetailInfo]: 1. root cause: hmi, info-report crash in usb device mode.
                systemd will re-launch hmi or info-report. but usb can't be detected
                again.
              2. solution: gaunrantee usb mode is host mode when hmi or
                info-report service re-launch.
              3. verified: ok
              4. dependency: hmi

Change-Id: I51f6056de0f353e74672c80512520233f352febe

subject: hmi, info-report crash happen after carplay connect. usb will still in device mode, which cause usb can't be detected for ever.
commitMessage:
hmi, info-report crash happen after carplay connect.
usb will still in device mode, which cause usb can't
be detected for ever.

[IssueID]: TS-BUG-5362
[Component]: Carplay
[Module]: Middleware
[ITChecklistAddress]: NULL
[OpenSourceInfo]:

                systemd will re-launch hmi or info-report. but usb can't
                be detected again.

              3. verified: ok
